column1: that it is untenable and false in the light of the evidence led by the prosecution.”

column2: “There is a serious misdirection in law. It is a grave error for a Trial
Judge  to  direct  himself  that  he  must  examine  the  tenability  and
truthfulness of the evidence of the accused in the light of the evidence
led by the prosecution. To examine the evidence of the accused, in the
light  of  the  prosecution  witnesses  is  to  reverse  the  presumption  of
innocence.    It  is  also  worth  mentioning  that  the  learned  High  Court
extensively in determining that there is no doubt as to the prosecution
case. It is trite law that the prosecution must stand on its own legs
